name: vscode-style-formatter
description: Applies format rule to a file

sfmt.braces.description: Sets the style of indentation during CSS and JavaScript beautification. The default value "knr" and the other value "allman" puts opening curly braces.

sfmt.cssinsertlines.description: Forces new line characters between blocks of CSS code. This option will override option preserve.

sfmt.insize.description: Stores the number of times the inchar value must repeat to comprise a single indentation.

sfmt.noleadzero.description: If in CSS values leading 0s immediately preceeding a decimal should be removed or prevented.

sfmt.objsort.description: Sorts properties of objects in JavaScript and/or CSS and/or attributs in HTML. The accepted values determine which language this option should be applied.

sfmt.preserve.description: Retain empty lines in either JavaScript or CSS like languages. Consecutive empty lines will be converted to a single empty line.

sfmt.quoteconvert.description: Convert the quote characters delimiting strings from either double or single quotes to the other. Applies to JavaScript and CSS and to attributes in markup.

sfmt.selectorlist.description: Retains comma separated CSS selectors on a single line of code.

sfmt.textpreserve.description: Preserve all text exactly as provided. This option eliminates any sort of beautification or wrapping upon text content in markup type languages.

sfmt.vertical.description: If lists of assignments or properties should be vertically aligned for faster and easier reading. The accepted values determine to which language this option should be applied.

sfmt.comments.description: Determines whether comments should be indented. This property is only used in beautification mode.

sfmt.commline.description: Whether a blank line should be forced above markup comments.
